panel.title: Decoy Documents
panel.html: The concept of Decoy Documents has been around since the Egyptians left fake papyrus military orders out for the Assyrians. In recent times however, the concept not only includes disinformation but also the concept of alerting. Organizations can leave conspicuous documents in directories that are attractive to an adversary. Once the adversary reads or touches the file, the defender is alerted. Very similar to a canary in the coal mine alerting miners about invisible dangerous gasses. This “alerting” can be accomplished in a variety of ways but this app shows two. The first being to actually inject the word document with an embedded call back or “beacon”. This technique is commonly used by marketing companies to judge the efficacy of their marketing campaign. The goal is to have the word document reach back via HTTP or DNS. The second technique is to enable extra auditing on a “decoy” document or directory and setup alerting for those “trapped” alerts.
